newsitem.title: POLAND: Stomil eyes steel-wired tyre market.
newsitem.headline: Stomil eyes steel-wired tyre market.

text.p: Polish tyre maker Stomil Olsztyn SA, controlled by French Cie Gnrale des Ets Michelin, plans to snatch a 30 percent market share for steel-wired truck tyres, its trade director said on Wednesday.
"Our aim is to quickly get a 30 percent market share," Bohdan Stankiewicz told a news conference, adding that this year Stomil eyed 20 percent of the market for in the product.

Stomil launched production of steel-wired tyres in March this year. Earlier this year, Stomil said it wanted to increase its market share in passenger car tyres to 50 percent from the current 26 percent.
Stomil's main Polish competitor -- Debica, controlled by United States' Goodyear Corp. -- now has a 67 percent market share in passenger car tyres.
Stankiewicz confirmed that Stomil plans to invest $150 million over the next three years to help win the targeted market shares.
Stomil netted 23.6 million zlotys on sales of 314.7 million zlotys in the first half of the year, compared with 36.2 million zlotys on 257.8 million zlotys in the same period of 1995.
